Multicomponent Thermodynamic And Transport Properties for Ionized gases in C++

1 #include <iostream>
2 
3 #include "mutation++.h"
4 using namespace Mutation;
5 
6 void printModel(Mixture& mix)
7 {
8  std::cout << "# of elements: " << mix.nElements() << '\n';
9  std::cout << "# of species: " << mix.nSpecies() << ' ';
10  std::cout << mix.nGas() << " (gas) " << mix.nCondensed() << " (condensed)\n";
11  std::cout << "# of reactions: " << mix.nReactions() << '\n';
12  std::cout << "# of temperatures: " << mix.nEnergyEqns() << "\n\n";
13 
14  std::cout << "Species:\n";
15  for (auto& s: mix.species())
16  std::cout << s.name() << ' ';
17  std::cout << "\n\n";
18 
19  std::cout << "Reactions:\n";
20  for (auto& r: mix.reactions())
21  std::cout << r.formula() << '\n';
22 }
23 
24 void printState(Mixture& mix)
25 {
26  std::vector<double> T(mix.nEnergyEqns());
27  mix.getTemperatures(T.data());
28 
29  std::cout << "\nTemperature(s) [K]: ";
30  for (auto v: T) std::cout << v << ' ';
31 
32  std::cout << "\nPressure [Pa]: " << mix.P();
33 
34  std::cout << "\nSpecies mole fractions:\n";
35  for (int i = 0; i < mix.nSpecies(); ++i)
36  std::cout << mix.speciesName(i) << ": " << mix.X()[i] << '\n';
37 }
38 
39 void printProperties(Mixture& mix)
40 {
41  std::cout << "\nMixture enthalpy [J/kg]: " << mix.mixtureHMass();
42  std::cout << "\nMixture entropy [J/kg-K]: " << mix.mixtureSMass();
43 
44  std::vector<double> lambda(mix.nEnergyEqns());
45  mix.frozenThermalConductivityVector(lambda.data());
46  std::cout << "\nMixture thermal conductivities [W/m-K]: ";
47  for (auto v: lambda) std::cout << v << ' ';
48 
49  std::cout << "\nMixture dynamic viscosity [Pa-s]: " << mix.viscosity();
50  std::cout << '\n';
51 }
52 
53 void partOne()
54 {
55  std::cout << "\n\n*** PART ONE ***\n";
56  Mixture mix("air_5");
57  printModel(mix);
58 
59  mix.equilibrate(300.0, ONEATM);
60  printState(mix);
61  printProperties(mix);
62 
63  mix.equilibrate(5000.0, ONEATM);
64  printState(mix);
65  printProperties(mix);
66 
67  std::vector<double> rho(mix.nSpecies()), T(mix.nEnergyEqns());
68  mix.getTemperatures(T.data());
69  mix.densities(rho.data());
70 
71  const int use_rhoi_and_t = 1;
72  mix.setState(rho.data(), T.data(), use_rhoi_and_t);
73  printState(mix);
74  printProperties(mix);
75 }
76 
77 void partTwo()
78 {
79  std::cout << "\n\n*** PART TWO ***\n";
80  MixtureOptions opts("air_5");
81  opts.setStateModel("ChemNonEqTTv");
82  opts.setThermodynamicDatabase("RRHO");
83  opts.setViscosityAlgorithm("Gupta-Yos");
84  Mixture mix(opts);
85  printModel(mix);
86 
87  mix.equilibrate(5000.0, ONEATM);
88  printState(mix);
89  printProperties(mix);
90 }
91 
92 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
93 {
94  partOne();
95  partTwo();
96 
97  return 0;
98 }
